name: Hyatt Regency Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at numerous Hyatt hotels and can say with certainty that is the worst Hyatt by far.
reviews.title: Hyatt Regency Cancun: Beautiful View, Horrible Hotel

reviews.text: When making travel plans for Cancun, we used priceline and selected a 4-start hotel in the hotel zone. We bid $65 and were given the Hyatt Regency Cancun. We thought we bid well and were looking forward to a great stay in Cancun.
reviews.title: The friendliest hotel in Cancun!

reviews.text: Upon our arrival at the hotel, we were impressed with the atrium lobby and design of the hotel. It was clearly an older hotel, but the public spaces seemed very well maintained and had a retro-modern look and feel.
reviews.title: Never Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were assigned a city/street view room, so we inquired about upgrading to an oceanview room. We were quoted $20 extra per night and went for it. We taken to a room on the 4th floor.
reviews.title: nice beach view....

reviews.text: Our initial impression of the room was fine. Minimalistic room, simple, with a great view of the beach and ocean. Upon closer inspection however, we found the room to be very filthy. Filthy is acutally an understatement. It actually was one of the dirtiest hotels that I have ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Great and not so great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only there for one night at the end of our vacation. The staff is for the most part is unfreindly, the AC in the room was stuck a freezing, pool/beach service was below par, the bed was a step above a futon, music went to all hours of the night with zero regard to other guests and the pricing was out of line for last minute. The highlight was the beach and the ocean however that can be done at many other locales in this part of the world. Just stay somewhere else you will be glad!
reviews.title: Very disatisifed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was exactly what my BF and I were looking for when we booked our Cancun vacation! The design of the hotel itself and the property is modern and minimalist, yet beautiful. The rooms are simple, yet updated and cozy. The view from the room is to die for - overlooking the ocean and the beach. The service is extremely friendly and impeccable. The beach is georgeous - plenty of space, and calm waters. We did not spend much time at the pool, as we are beach bums, but the pool was nicely designed as well.
reviews.title: Tranqulity

reviews.text: Prices at the hotel are high, just like any other non-inclusive in the Hotel zone; however, the location of the hotel is walking distance to many other establishments - OXXO is right across the street, and Starbucks is a 5 minute walk, etc.
reviews.title: Beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time and we will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel. Even better view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is nice and beautiful. The outside area is amazing. The rooms are quite good and roomy. The breakfast is excellent, it is a good idea to get the breakfast included rate.
reviews.title: Great, bang for your buck place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for the 1st leg of our honeymoon on Gold Passport points, staying 5 nights in a Regency Suite and 4 nights in an Ocean View room.... and I was VERY VERY happy! The Hyatt has to be in one of the best spots in the Cancun hotel zone, being just a short walk from the hustle and bussle of the nightclub/restaurant strip, and even closer to bus stops to catch the bus into downtown Cancun. Yeah OK, the hotel is a little old.... but as soon as you open the blinds to the balcony you immediately forget the room behind you, with one of the best views in Cancun right in front of you, and besides that - you are in CANCUN; you should be out on the beach, in a restaurant, seeing the sights and havintg fun OUTDOORS, not cooped up in your hotel room whining about the water pressure and the dated decor (which PS, i thought was fine and very befitting of the region).
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So here's my rundown in point form:
reviews.title: Quiet & Relaxing = Excellent Stay
Breathtaking view of the ocean and super comfortable rooms.
reviews.text: - FANTASTIC location in the Cancun hotel zone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - breakfast buffet was good, as was the free Regency Club breakfast (which you get with regency club rooms)
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise and a Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - FREE DRINKS between 5-7pm in the Regency Club room if you have a Regency club room
reviews.title: Best safe beach in all area, great pool, quiet no hurry for chair etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i found the hyatt regency in cancun to be a really good hotel. two swimming pools, a gym, two bars (one by the pool), two restuarants, a deli and a spa. the standard of food was pretty decent and when i stayed there they were running a promotion, if you paid money in advance onto you room you were given double the credit. so that basically means you are getting all your drinks and food at half price which made it very good value for money.
reviews.title: excellent level of service

reviews.text: the service was first class, always with a smile, from the cleaner to the reception workers and everyone inbetween.
reviews.title: Great location,clean and nice!!!
Loved This Hotel!
reviews.text: another nice touch was that they had two activities co ordinators who organised activities for guests from 9am till 6pm. beach volleyball, beach soccer, water volleyball, ping pong, water aeurobics etc. the organisers were really fun and friendly and i had a lot of fun participating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: all in all i think the hotel was really good value for money as the service and amenties were top class and the prices were really reasonable.
reviews.title: Great location, awesome beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a very nice hotel! im so glad i've stayed here!!! Location is great, right in the middle of everything (shopping,party, restaurants... ) The staff is very nice,speak English and taught us some espanol :) Room service is very fast and not overpriced . From the airport we took a shuttle for only 15$. Also we bought some tours from the agent in the hotel and got a really good deals!!! The only disappointing thing was that there's no free wifi, but on the opposite side its a good thing,because you dont seat by the laptop all day uploading pict on facebook ;) I would definitely stayed here again!
reviews.title: Best hotel in Cancun!

description: Located in the heart of Cancun Hotel Zone, Hyatt Regency Cancun hotel features a superb location and a new and extensive white sand beach, with breath-taking views over the Caribbean Sea and Nichupté lagoon. Just a few steps from shopping centres, restaurants, cultural attractions and the nightlife area of the city. Our Beach House Spa is a holistic concept of rejuvenating mind and body.
